com.aol.simple.react

Class SimpleReact

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aol.simple.react.SimpleReact
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Return type of object created by initial Suppliers

    public class SimpleReact
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point for creating a concurrent dataflow.
    Author:
    johnmcclean

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleReact()
      Construct a new SimpleReact that will use a ForkJoinPool with parrellism set to the number of processors on the host
      SimpleReact(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)

        Start a reactive dataflow with a list of one-off-suppliers
        Parameters:

      • react

        public <U> Stage<U> react(java.util.Iterator<U> iterator,
                          int maxTimes)
        Start a reactive flow from a JDK Iterator
        Parameters:
        iterator - SimpleReact will iterate over this iterator concurrently to start the reactive dataflow
        maxTimes - Maximum number of iterations
        Returns:
        Next stage in the reactive flow

      • reactToCollection

        public <R> Stage<R> reactToCollection(java.util.Collection<R> collection)
        Start a reactive flow from a Collection using an Iterator
        Parameters:
        collection - - Collection SimpleReact will iterate over at the start of the flow
        Returns:
        Next stage in the reactive flow

      • react

        public <U> Stage<U> react(java.util.function.Supplier<U> s,
                          Generator t)
        Start a reactive dataflow from a single Supplier, which will be executed repeatedly according to rules defined by the generator. Example : To execute the same Supplier 4 times use : List strings = new SimpleReact() . react(() -> count++ ,SimpleReact.times(4)) To skip the first 5 iterations and take the next 5 * List strings = new SimpleReact() . react(() -> count++ ,SimpleReact.times(5).offset(5)) The supplier will be called 10 times, in the above example, but only the last 5 results will be passed into the reactive dataflow.
        Parameters:
        s - Supplier to provide data (and thus events) that downstream jobs will react too
        t - Generator implementation that will determine how the Supplier is executed
        Returns:
        Next stage in the reactive flow

      • times

        public static ParallelGenerator times(int times)
        Create a Sequential Generator that will trigger a Supplier to be called the specified number of times
        Parameters:
        times - Number of times the Supplier should be called at the start of the reactive dataflow
        Returns:
        Sequential Generator

      • timesInSequence

        public static ParallelGenerator timesInSequence(int times)
        Create a Parallel Generator that will trigger a Supplier to be called the specified number of times
        Parameters:
        times - Number of times the Supplier should be called at the start of the reactive dataflow
        Returns:
        Parellel Generator

      • react

        public <U> Stage<U> react(java.util.function.Function<U,U> f,
                          ReactIterator<U> t)
        Start a reactive dataflow that calls the supplied function iteratively, with each output, feeding into the next input Example :- List results = new SimpleReact() . react((input) -> input + 1,iterate(0).times(1).offset(10))
        Parameters:
        f - Function to be called iteratively
        t - Iterator that manages function call
        Returns:
        Next stage in the reactive flow

      • iterate

        public static <T> ReactIterator<T> iterate(T seed)
        Create an iterator that manages a function call starting with the supplied seed value
        Parameters:
        seed - Initial value that iterator will apply to the function it iterates over
        Returns:
        Populated ReactIterator
